sen.j: 京都市役所前駅（きょうとしやくしょまええき）は、京都市中京区にある、京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station is a stop on Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway.
Located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station is a stop on the Tozai Line of the Kyoto City Subway.
Located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station is a stop on the Tozai Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway.

sen.j: 駅番号はT12。
sen.e: The station number is T12.
The station number is T12.
The station number is T12.

sen.j: ステーションカラーは韓紅（からくれない）。
sen.e: Its station color is Korean-red..
Its station color is Korean red.
Its station color is Korean red.

sen.j: 河原町御池交差点の下に位置するため、駅名標に「（河原町御池）」と添えられている（六地蔵駅まで路線が延伸された前後より付記された）。
sen.e: Since this station is located under the Kawaramachi Oike crossing, the description of "Kawaramachi Oike" is additionally placed on the station name board (this description has been added around when the line was extended to Rokujizo Station).

Because this station is located under the Kawaramachi Oike crossing, the description "Kawaramachi Oike" is additionally placed on the station-name board (this description was added around the time that the line was extended to Rokujizo Station).

Because this station is located under the Kawaramachi Oike crossing, the description 'Kawaramachi Oike' is additionally placed on the station-name board (this description was added around the time that the line was extended to Rokujizo Station).

sen.j: プラットホーム分類1面2線の地下駅である。
sen.e: An underground station with a platform serving two tracks.
It is an underground station with a platform serving two tracks.
It is an underground station with a platform serving two tracks.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: The entrance/exit gates are provided only at a location within the station.
The entrance/exit gates are provided only at a location within the station.
The ticket gates are provided only at a location within the station.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gates としました。

sen.j: 改札を出ると、ゼスト御池の東端部に接している。
sen.e: Exiting from the gate, you will come to the east end of Zest Oike.
Exiting from the gate, you will come to the east end of Zest Oike.
Exiting from the gate, you will come to the east end of Zest Oike.

sen.j: 京阪京津線直通列車の一部は当駅で折り返しとなる。
sen.e: Some of the Keihan Keishin Line trains providing through service return at this station.
Some of the Keihan Keishin Line trains providing through-service return at this station.
Some of the Keihan Keishin Line trains providing through-service return at this station.

sen.j: その関係で、西方に引き上げ線がある。
sen.e: Therefore, side tracks are provided on the western side.
Therefore, side tracks are provided on the western side.
Therefore, side tracks are provided on the western side.

sen.j: 御陵駅とは異なり、当駅始発列車であっても発車時の自動放送は行われていない。
sen.e: Contrasting with Misasagi Station, no announment for departure is made even for the trains that start their run at this station.
In contrast with Misasagi Station, departure announcements aren't made even for the trains that start out from this station.
In contrast with Misasagi Station, departure announcements aren't made even for the trains that start out from this station.

sen.j: なお京阪京津線については、2008年1月16日の太秦天神川駅開業までは当駅で全列車が浜大津方面へ折り返していた。
sen.e: On Keihan Keishin Line, all trains from the direction of Hamaotsu retuned from this station before Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station started its operation on January 16, 2008.
On the Keihan Keishin Line, all trains from the direction of Hamaotsu returned from this station before Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station became operational on January 16, 2008.
On the Keihan Keishin Line, all trains from the direction of Hamaotsu returned from this station before Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station became operational on January 16, 2008.

sen.j: かつての東西線の最西駅である二条駅まで直通しなかったのは、京阪電気鉄道との車両使用料の関係が大きいとされる。
sen.e: Through service was not provided up to Nijo Station, the former west-end station on Tozai Line, and it is said that the reason was mostly concerned with relationships with Keihan Electric Railway about use rates of train cars.

Through-service wasn't provided up to Nijo Station, the former west-end station on the Tozai Line, and it is said that the reason generally pertained to relationships with Keihan Electric Railway about the usage rates of train cars.

Through-service wasn't provided up to Nijo Station, the former west-end station on the Tozai Line, and it is said that the reason generally pertained to relationships with Keihan Electric Railway about the usage rates of train cars.

sen.j: しかし、「たった一駅の差で足止めされる」という烏丸御池駅での京都市営地下鉄烏丸線乗り換え客からの不平不満の声も散見されていた。
sen.e: However, since the passengers to switch the train line at Karasuma Oike Station to Karasuma Line of Kyoto city Subway had to change the train at the last stop before the station, complaints about the situation wre somtimes heard.

However, because passengers who would switch the train line at Karasuma Oike Station to Karasuma Line of Kyoto city Subway had to change trains at the last stop before the station, complaints about the situation were sometimes heard.

However, because passengers who would switch the train line at Karasuma Oike Station to Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway had to change trains at the last stop before the station, complaints about the situation were sometimes heard.

sen.j: 但し太秦天神川駅までの直通列車は、今でも1日76往復（平日）の乗り入れ列車のうち、早朝・深夜を除く28往復と1/3程度にとどまっている。
sen.e: However, even now, of the 76 round-trip operations a week day conducted encompassing the two lines, only 28 (approx. one-third) of them provide through service up to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, except during the early morning and deep night.

Even now, of the 76 round-trip operations each weekday conducted between the two lines, only 28 (approximately one-third) of them provide through-service up to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, except during the early morning and late night.

Even now, of the 76 round-trip operations each weekday conducted between the two lines, only 28 (approximately one-third) of them provide through-service up to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, except during the early morning and late night.

sen.j: 1997年10月12日の醍醐～二条間開業と同時期に、地下街であるゼスト御池と公営の大規模な地下駐車場とこの駅とが出来上がった。
sen.e: On October 12, 1997, when operation between Daigo and Nijo started, the construction of this station was completed together with Zest Oike, an undeground shopping area、and a large-scale underground public car park.

On October 12, 1997, when operations between Daigo and Nijo started, the construction of this station was completed together with Zest Oike, an underground shopping area, as well as a large-scale underground public car park.

October 12, 1997: When operations between Daigo and Nijo started, the construction of this station was completed together with Zest Oike, an underground shopping area, as well as a large-scale underground public car park.

sen.j: 景観論争で諸寺院の建設反対運動があった京都ホテル（旧京都ホテル）とゼスト御池は地下で連絡している。
sen.e: Kyoto Hotel (the former Kyoto Hotel), against the construction of which temples promoted a protest campain saying that it wiould disrupt the landscape, and Zest Oike are connected undeground.
Kyoto Hotel (the former Kyoto Hotel), against whose construction temples promoted a protest campaign saying it would disrupt the landscape, is connected with Zest Oike via an underground access.
Kyoto Hotel (the former Kyoto Hotel), against whose construction temples promoted a protest campaign saying it would disrupt the landscape, is connected with Zest Oike via an underground access.

sen.j: 地下街のゼスト御池は、烏丸御池駅とも繋がっていると勘違いされることがあるが、実際には京都市役所前駅からのみしか連絡していない。
sen.e: Altough it is sometimes misunderstood that the underground shopping area of Zest Oike is connected to Karasuma Oike Station as well, the area is connected actually only to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station.
Although it is sometimes misunderstood that the underground shopping area of Zest Oike is also connected to Karasuma Oike Station, the area is actually connected only to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station.
Although it is sometimes misunderstood that the underground shopping area of Zest Oike is also connected to Karasuma Oike Station, the area is in fact connected only to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station.

sen.j: 大阪のクリスタ長堀のような複数の駅を連絡するような規模の大きな地下街とは異なる。
sen.e: This underground shopping area is different from large-scale ones, such as CRYSTA Nagahori in Osak where more than one station is connected.
This underground shopping area is different from large-scale facilities such as CRYSTA Nagahori in Osaka, to which more than one station is connected.
This underground shopping area is different from large-scale facilities such as CRYSTA Nagahori in Osaka, to which more than one station is connected.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa became usable.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa came into use.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa came into use.

sen.j: 開業前段階では、単に「市役所前」駅となる予定であったが、それが変更されて「京都市役所前」として開業した（京都市営バスの「河原町二条」停留所も同時にこの駅名と同じ停留所名に改称された。
sen.e: Before the station started its operation, it was planned to name the station "Shiyakusho-mae," but the name was actually changed to "Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae" (at the same timing, the name of the "Kawamachi-Nijo" stop on the routes of Kyoto City Bus was also changed to the same name as that of the station).

Before the station started its operation, it was planned to name the station "Shiyakusho-mae," but the name was actually changed to "Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae" (at the same time, the name of the "Kawamachi-Nijo" stop on the routes of Kyoto City Bus was changed to match the name of the station).

Before the station started its operation, it was planned to name the station 'Shiyakusho-mae,' but the name was in fact changed to 'Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae' (at the same time, the name of the 'Kawaramachi-Nijo' stop on the routes of Kyoto City Bus was changed to match the name of the station.
sen.cmt: " →' としました。Kawaramachi としました。"actually"→"in fact"に変更しました。

sen.j: 但し京都バスなどの民間バス会社はそのままである）。
sen.e: However, private bus companies, such as Kyoto Bus, use the name of "Kawamachi-Nijo"without changing it.
However, private bus companies such as Kyoto Bus use the name "Kawamachi-Nijo" without changing it.
However, private bus companies such as Kyoto Bus use the name 'Kawaramachi-Nijo' without changing it.)
sen.cmt: " →' としました。Kawaramachi としました。

sen.j: これは、大津方面から乗り入れてくる列車があるための配慮であると思われる（大津市役所の最寄り駅は京阪石山坂本線別所駅 (滋賀県)）。
sen.e: This naming is supposed to have been made considering that there are trains coming from the direction of Otsu (the station nearest to Otsu City Office is Bessho Station on Keihan Ishiyama-Sakamoto Line (in Shiga Prefecture).

This name is supposed to have been applied in consideration of the fact that there were trains coming from the direction of Otsu (the station nearest to the Otsu City Office is Bessho Station on the Keihan Ishiyama-Sakamoto Line, in Shiga Prefecture).

This name is supposed to have been applied in consideration of the fact that there were trains coming from the direction of Otsu (the station nearest to the Otsu City Hall is Bessho Station on the Keihan Ishiyama-Sakamoto Line, in Shiga Prefecture).

sen.j: 京都市民はこの交差点付近のことを河原町御池交差点と呼ぶことが多く、場所を示すために「市役所前」と呼ぶ習慣は余り見られなかった。
sen.e: For indicating the area around this crossing, residents in Kyoto have mostly used the expression of the Kawaramachi Oike crossing, with the expression of "Shiyakusho-mae" used rarely.
To indicate the area around this crossing, residents of Kyoto have mostly used the expression of the Kawaramachi Oike crossing, so the expression "Shiyakusho-mae" is rarely used.
To indicate the area around this crossing, residents of Kyoto have mostly used the expression of the Kawaramachi Oike crossing, so the expression 'Shiyakusho-mae' is rarely used.

sen.j: それはこの駅が開業後も同じである。
sen.e: This situation remains unchanged even after this station started its operation.
This situation remains unchanged despite this station's start of operations.
This situation remains unchanged despite this station's start of operations.
